FuncDef:
The any-address-release offline command configures a device to forcibly log out a dual-stack user if the user releases any IP address.
The undo any-address-release offline command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device does not forcibly log out a dual-stack user when the user releases an IP address.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A dual-stack user remains online so long as the user has at least one available IP address. If you want a device to forcibly log out a dual-stack user when the user releases any IP address, run the any-address-release offline command.
This command applies to only PPPoX users.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The ppp address-release separate and any-address-release offline commands are mutually exclusive.
This command is used to process DHCPv6 Release messages on clients. By default, DHCPv6 Release messages on clients are not processed.
